content.en: FPGA-enhanced Induction Motors: Researchers have been investigating the use of Field-Programmable Gate Arrays (FPGAs) to improve the control of induction motors. FPGAs are being used to reduce hardware costs, enable high-speed processing, and provide flexibility in the control system. By implementing algorithms on FPGAs, researchers have found improvements in speed control, torque estimation, and the overall performance of induction motor drives.
content.da: FPGA-forbedrede induktionsmotorer: Forskere har undersøgt brugen af Field-Programmable Gate Arrays (FPGAs) for at forbedre styringen af induktionsmotorer. FPGAs bruges til at reducere hardwareomkostninger, muliggøre højhastighedsbehandling og give fleksibilitet i styresystemet. Ved at implementere algoritmer på FPGAs har forskerne fundet forbedringer i hastighedsregulering, momentestimering og den samlede ydeevne af induktionsmotorer.
